medical_information.primary_uses: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, to reduce risk of cardiovascular death in adults with type 2 diabetes and established cardiovascular disease, heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
medical_information.contraindications: Severe renal impairment, end-stage renal disease, dialysis, hypersensitivity to empagliflozin
medical_information.side_effects: Urinary tract infections, female genital mycotic infections, increased urination, thirst, hypoglycemia (when used with insulin or insulin secretagogues)
medical_information.drug_interactions: Diuretics, insulin, insulin secretagogues, other antihyperglycemic drugs
medical_information.warnings_precautions: Hypotension, ketoacidosis, acute kidney injury, urosepsis and pyelonephritis, hypoglycemia, necrotizing fasciitis of the perineum (Fournier's gangrene)
medical_information.pregnancy_nursing: Not recommended during second and third trimesters; use during first trimester or breastfeeding only if clearly needed

composition.inactive_ingredients: Water for injection, sodium chloride, monobasic sodium phosphate dihydrate, dibasic sodium phosphate dihydrate, sodium citrate, citric acid monohydrate, mannitol, polysorbate 80

administration.special_instructions: Refrigerate until ready to use; allow to reach room temperature before injecting. Rotate injection sites
administration.storage_requirements: Refrigerate at 36-46°F (2-8°C). Do not freeze. Protect from light

medical_information.primary_uses: Rheumatoid arthritis, juvenile idiopathic arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, plaque psoriasis, hidradenitis suppurativa, uveitis
medical_information.contraindications: Serious active infection, hypersensitivity to adalimumab
medical_information.side_effects: Injection site reactions, upper respiratory infections, headache, rash, sinusitis, nausea
medical_information.drug_interactions: Live vaccines, anakinra, abatacept, other TNF blockers
medical_information.warnings_precautions: Serious infections, malignancy, reactivation of hepatitis B, demyelinating disease, cytopenias, heart failure, hypersensitivity reactions
medical_information.pregnancy_nursing: Consider risks and benefits during pregnancy and breastfeeding; crosses the placenta during third trimester

administration.special_instructions: Take with or without food
administration.duration_of_treatment: Long-term therapy for HIV treatment; daily use for PrEP
administration.storage_requirements: Store at room temperature away from moisture and heat

medical_information.primary_uses: HIV-1 infection treatment (in combination with other antiretrovirals), pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) to reduce risk of sexually acquired HIV-1 in high-risk individuals
medical_information.contraindications: Unknown or positive HIV-1 status when used for PrEP, hypersensitivity to components
medical_information.side_effects: Nausea, headache, diarrhea, fatigue, dizziness, depression, insomnia, abnormal dreams, rash
medical_information.drug_interactions: Didanosine, atazanavir, lopinavir/ritonavir, drugs that reduce renal function or compete for active tubular secretion
medical_information.warnings_precautions: New onset or worsening renal impairment, lactic acidosis, severe hepatomegaly with steatosis, bone loss and mineralization defects, immune reconstitution syndrome
medical_information.pregnancy_nursing: Pregnancy Exposure Registry for pregnant women exposed to Truvada; use during pregnancy or breastfeeding only if clearly needed

composition.strength_dosage: 11.7mg etonogestrel/2.7mg ethinyl estradiol per ring (releases 0.12mg/0.015mg per day)
composition.inactive_ingredients: Ethylene vinylacetate copolymers, magnesium stearate

administration.recommended_dosage: One ring for 3 weeks, followed by 1 week ring-free
administration.special_instructions: Insert into vagina and leave in place for 3 weeks, then remove for 1 week. Start new ring after 1-week break
administration.duration_of_treatment: As long as contraception is desired
administration.storage_requirements: Refrigerate before dispensing; after dispensing, store at room temperature for up to 4 months

medical_information.primary_uses: Prevention of pregnancy
medical_information.contraindications: High risk of arterial or venous thrombotic diseases, current or history of breast cancer or other estrogen- or progestin-sensitive cancer, liver tumors or disease, undiagnosed abnormal uterine bleeding, pregnancy
medical_information.side_effects: Headache, nausea, vomiting, breast tenderness, spotting, vaginal discharge, vaginal irritation
medical_information.drug_interactions: CYP3A4 inducers (e.g., rifampin, carbamazepine, phenytoin), HIV protease inhibitors, certain antibiotics, St. John's wort
medical_information.warnings_precautions: Increased risk of cardiovascular events (particularly in smokers >35 years old), liver disease, hypertension, gallbladder disease, diabetes, depression
medical_information.pregnancy_nursing: Contraindicated during pregnancy; not recommended during breastfeeding
